wikipedia_page.main: Beatrice Clugston (19 September 1827 – 5 June 1888) was a British philanthropist in Glasgow.

response: One Dorcas society was founded in Douglas, Isle of Man, in December 1834 as part of the community's thanksgiving for being spared from an outbreak of cholera.Isle of Man Dorcas Society Other Dorcas societies were established by missionaries in the Americas in the early 1800s. Beatrice Clugston founded the Glasgow Royal Dorcas Society in 1864. One English Dorcas society in Sydenham, London, met during five Tuesdays in Lent, producing 166 garments in one year.

The hospital, which was financed by a donation from Beatrice Clugston as a facility for incurable patients such as those suffering from cancer, opened in 1876. The Lanfine Home for patients suffering from tuberculosis was added in 1904. After joining the National Health Service in 1948, the hospital continued to care for chronically ill patients until it closed in 1995. The buildings, other than an old gatehouse, have been demolished and planning consent has been given for the site to be redeveloped for residential use.
